channel.title: Korean on Table41NYC
channel.description: Recent content in Korean on Table41NYC

item.title: Bonchon
item.description: Pretty bad and expensive. 10 pieces of bites fro $14, and it doesn’t even come with a drink.

item.title: Samwon Garden Bbq
item.description: Pretty decent Korean BBQ. Also a bit expensive, and not as good as Let’s Meat. {{ < relref “/posts/korean/lets-meat.md” >}}

item.title: Let's Meat
item.description: Pretty decent Korean BBQ. A bit expensive, but everything was good.

item.title: Her Name Is Han
item.description: Pretty good Korean food. Fairly priced and family style. They have BOSSAM, and it was really good.

item.title: Barn Joo
item.description: Pretty good Korean American bar food outside of k-town. Not too expensive I think.

item.title: To Two Boonsik
item.description: This place is ok. Got the japchae and soondobu. Cheap though.

item.title: Tofu Tofu
item.description: Pretty good soon dobu and bo ssam. Lots of food for 1 person. Would come back here again if I was craving bo ssasm I think.

item.title: Jeju Noodle Bar
item.description: Pretty good Korean ramyun. A little pricey though.

item.title: Atoboy
item.description: Really good for the price point. $39 tasting 3 courses, no tip, and no dessert.

item.title: Bulbap Grill
item.description: This place was ok in Greenpoint. The soondobu was probably the better thing to get. They do have Korean style tacos.

item.title: Jongro
item.description: Pretty good. No Korean rice wrap, but meat quality was good.

item.title: Pelicana Chicken
item.description: Korean wings. They have ice cream beer which was a gimmick. It’s mediocre at best. They do give you these finger “condom” looking things to handle the chicken.

item.title: Kichin
item.description: Decent bibimbap, but don’t go out of your way for this.

item.title: Dotory
item.description: Really good. I like their kimchi jigae because it’s super sour. Don’t get their soondobu. It sucks.
